TopicTitle: "A Small Step For A Kerbal, A Big Leap For The Kebkind" Challenge

Articles.Content:
Hello everyone! this is my second challenge! i hope you like it!

So what you got to do:

1) Make a rocket available to get up the 10,000m mark

2) And land safely

RULES:

1)Land ONLY using RCS\'s and 2 RCS fuel tanks.

2)Stock parts only, up to Experimental Release .11x4.

3) NO SAS module

Screenshots are necessary for your entry to be valid:

1) launchpad

2) 10,000m or above 8)

3) falling to kearth ;P

4) using RCS to slow down your fall ???

Tips:

1) place 8 RCS\'s in the RCS fuel tank to use all they power

This one should be interesting.

Time to unzip x4.

EDIT: As it turns out, 16 RCS\'s barely have enough power to lift one tank and the capsule. This poses a problem.

Initial tests show that the lander has a tendency to tilt, giving it more sideways speed than vertical braking. Hilarity ensues momentarily.

This one should be interesting.

Time to unzip x4.

EDIT: As it turns out, 16 RCS\'s barely have enough power to lift one tank and the capsule. This poses a problem.

Initial tests show that the lander has a tendency to tilt, giving it more sideways speed than vertical braking. Hilarity ensues momentarily.

Yea, alternating sets of 6 with a total of 24 RCS\'s barely casue it to lift.

Yea, alternating sets of 6 with a total of 24 RCS\'s barely casue it to lift.

use 3 RCS fuel tanks and go: 8/6/8 it give stability and slow more faster then the normal 6/6/6
I\'ll need to try this later; I need to run a virus scan on my pc.

So here\'s the problem I\'ve run into: I can\'t slow down the capsule to a safe speed when trying to land. Goes from about 25 m/s to 35 m/s, which is about 34 m/s when I crash.

I\'m tagging foamyesque, DrEvo, CarolRawley, C7Studios, and Sordid to figure this out.

like jeb says... 'use more BOOSTER!' in this case RCS\'s i made it but i destroy everything.. except the capsule.. you have to go like 10-12m/s
